intro: Boechera depauperata, commonly known as the poorflower bladderpod, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is a member of the Brassicaceae family, which includes mustard and cress plants. This species is characterized by its low-growing habit, with small, pale green leaves and clusters of tiny white flowers. Boechera depauperata typically thrives in rocky or sandy soils and is often found in dry, open habitats. Its ecological role includes providing nectar for pollinators and serving as a food source for certain insects.
